section.name: Bob's web-store example.
section.h4: Bob's pizza web-store example. Part 3, prices depend on buyer, prices in foreign currency.
section.p:
To make different prices for different buyers you should open menu -> Administrator then:
set in "... -> Trading settings - Price for customer" to "Yes"
add price category in Pricing with name "Silver buyers":
add this "silver buyers" into Price categories for buyers in Pricing, e.g. for buyer Dilon Smith:
then add prices for goods/services, e.g. seller Yoga Teacher price for uniform:
As a result prices for registered user with "Silver price category" and newbie (just clear cookie cBuyerId and buSeId) are different:

It's used "Currency rates" in "menu -> Administrator -> Pricing" . Base currency is in "Accounting settings". Foreign price = price in base currency * currency rate. Exchange rate might has huge decimal places, e.g. 1USD=61.12RUB, base currency RUB, so rate is "0.0163612565445". To handle such rates just use negative value, i.e. "-61.12" in that case, application itself makes rate = 1/61.12. Example of exchange rates (base currency USD):
